runs.comm: length ball on middle which is defended solidly by de Kock. Good start from the left-armer
back of a length on middle and off and swinging in as Nasir holds strong
144 kph, fuller length ball which is heaved over midwicket without too much trouble. First boundary for South Africa as they are off the mark
134 kph, slightly slower as Irfan gets this to bounce a little higher and cut in, going over the stumps by not too much of a distance

137 kph, Irfan bangs it in short as de Kock goes for the lofted pull through midwicket. He instead hits this straight up towards mid-on, with the ball carrying far enough to beat the fielders inside the ring
raps Amla on the pads first up, but this one was outside the line so no appeal from the Pakistanis. The battle continues between Irfan and Amla, with the latter having his number of late
128 kph, and starts off with the most gentle of looseners down the leg side
125 kph, overpitched from Razzaq on middle as de Kock just hammers this back over to midwicket, with the ball hitting just before the rope. Umpire signals a four
Razzaq shortens his length and de Kock continues where he left off, belting this down the ground for another four
126 kph, de Kock steps down to this length ball, but drives straight to mid-off
Razzaq drops it short of a length as de Kock just tees off towards midwicket, with the result being another boundary. Third of the over. Razzaq under the cosh
124 kph, Razzaq pitches this on a length on leg stump, with de Kock swinging cross-batted, but failing to get any bat on it as the ball deflects to the off side off the pads
better line from Razzaq as he pitches this just outside off, with Amla making room to glide this down to third man
full and just outside off as Amla drives towards mid-off for a single
140 kph, length ball from Irfan as de Kock clears the front leg to whack this down to deep midwicket. De Kock is definitely looking to have a good time out there
131 kph, Amla stands tall as he flicks this length ball off the pads to the leg side

138 kph, fullish length from Irfan as de Kock goes for the flick down the leg side, but instead gets a leading edge which spoons up and over him and the keeper, and travels far enough to get to the fine leg boundary. Fortuitous there for the left-hander, as it looked all but out
starts round the wicket and pitches on a length which is nurdled to the leg side by de Kock
goes back over the wicket and gets this to spin into Amla from outside off, which Amla negotiates without issue
127 kph, fuller length ball on middle which de Kock drives straight down the ground, beating mid-on
122 kph, pitches this full again but wide outside off as he gets this to tail away. De Kock looking for the wide, but the umpire is not interested
133 kph, this time follows de Kock who looks to make room to his towards the off side. This one rushes him onto his pads just outside a leg stump line
low, full toss outside off which was begging to be hit to the boundary. Instead, de Kock times it sweetly to short extra-cover
134 kph, fuller length ball on middle and leg which Amla drives straight to mid-on
106 kph, shorter length ball which Amla eases down to third man off the back foot
lovely flighted ball which turns into Amla as he whisks it away to the leg side
flighted again on a more leg side line as Amla is able to flick this off his pads for one
short from Ajmal as de Kock has ample time to get on the back foot and power this away to the midwicket gap for a boundary

flighted once more as de Kock goes for bait with a slog sweep outside off. Hits this higher than farther away as the fielder stationed at deep midwicket comes in to pounce on the chance. Able to hold his nerve sufficiently as Pakistan make their first strike of the match
fired in on leg stump, Amla misses the glance as the ball goes off the pads to the leg-side
brings this in a bit closer as Amla goes for a sweep, which seems ill-advised, as the Pakistanis roar an appeal, but it is not given.
du Plessis opens his account with a gentle dab to third man for one
lovely line just outside off as Amla gets an outside edge which carries behind to the third man boundary for four. Lucky break there for Amla
lovely line just outside off as this one shapes into Amla. Amla able to guide this down to third man
full on middle and leg as Faf whips this away to the leg side

short this time from Tanvir as Amla goes for the hook. Amla looked surprised by that one as Umar Akmal takes the ball and goes up instantly. Tanvir follows suit but the umpire does not look interested
slower ball finishes off the over as Amla, looking to dab this down to third man again, is unable to get this way as it glides gently towards the keeper
lovely ball on middle and off as Faf turns this away to the leg side for a single
flighted just outside off as Amla rocks back to whisk this away to the leg side
this one seems to stop on Faf as he hits this uppishly towards silly mid-on, who dives forward, but is unable to get a hand to the bal
fired in slightly quicker as Faf is able to get off strike with a flick
drops it short as Amla gets on the back foot, but fails to pierce the gap on the leg side
pitches this on and around off as Faf gets a thick outside edge, with the ball carrying towards the off side. Faf meant to ease this down to mid-on
length ball just outside off as Faf defends this to the off side and is able to complete a quick single
shorter this time from Afridi as Amla gets back to play this late through third man for a well-placed boundary
fires this one in quickly as Amla defends solidly to the off side
a little shorter of a length as Amla uses his feet to hit this inside-out between deep mid-off and cover to find the boundary. Calculated risk there from the South African
length ball which is eased behind point for a single
Faf takes Amla's cue as he also advances down, but drives this along the ground to long-off
fired in a bit quicker that Faf expected as he just keeps this out
shorter length this time as Faf steps down and tries to work this through the gap on the leg side
Faf elects to go for the chip through midwicket, and the risk comes off fine, even though deep midwicket was only a couple of yards away from getting to the ball
full delivery on middle and leg as Amla tries to flick this away square on the leg side
back of a length on middle and leg as Hafeez goes for the appeal when this raps the right pad. Umpire just not amused
lovely line this from Hafeez as Amla steps back to work this away to the leg side, and keep strike for the next over
Dropped. This was given more air on off, Amla comes down the track and hits it in the air back to Afridi, who puts down a tough chance
Amla able to find two runs in the gap in midwicket. Excellent running between the pair
sweeps this round the corner to fine-leg for one
Faf targets the gap between long-on and midwicket to find a run
Amla finishes the over off with a gentle push to long-off to keep strike
low full toss on middle as Amla whips this off his pads for a single
Hafeez pauses in his delivery stride as Faf looks to make room by backing away. The end result is that he hits this back towards the bowler, rather ungainly at that
Faf able to nurdle this behind on the leg side
too short from Hafeez as Amla advances down to heave this towards square leg, with Nasir, running in from midwicket, unable to get his hands on it in time
slightly full as Amla gets down to try and get him away, but unable to get a connection on it
Amla gets it right this time as he sweetly times this over the long-on boundary for six
gets this to straighten upon pitching as Faf steers this towards mid-off, with the pair running the first hard, and get back in time to beat the incoming throw at the non-strikers
slightly quicker that goes on to Faf's pads as he tries to dab this behind for a couple
this one pitched straight enough as Faf steps down to heave this over the bowler's head to the straight boundary. Placement was simply exquisite
this one seems to stop on Faf as he completes his push towards mid-on
slightly quicker on off as Amla steers this through point
pitching just outside off and turning in as Faf is able to reach it and then club it down to the midwicket fence. This one goes all the way for six
flatter delivery and Amla whips it to the on side
the doosra completely squares him up!, Beaten outside off
drifts towards the leg side and he works it to deep midwicket
flatter delivery and he makes room and punches it to deep cover
take that! Faf had already made himself room before the delivery, Ajmal tossed it up and Faf slogged it fiercely over deep midwicket
goes back and clips it to the on side
comes round the wicket, it's a full toss down the leg side and smashed to deep square leg
shot! Tossed up and Amla makes room, comes down the pitch and lofts high over long-on
drags it shorter on seeing him come down the pitch, pulls behind square
flatter and it's a full toss which he whips to deep midwicket
slower through the air and he slogs him down to Ajmal at deep square leg
low full toss and he drills it down to long-on
flighted outside off on a length as Faf dances down to try and get this way, but misses the ball. Rushes back to the crease to avoid a stumping
this one is a bit shorter as Faf gets back to steer this through the off side
fired in outside off as Amla drives this powerfully to deep extra-cover

and Amla throws it away in an effort to look for quick runs as he positions himself to clear midwicket with another hoick, but ends up hitting this higher than farther as the fielder near the boundary is able to complete the take
AB tries to get off the mark from the first ball with a single down the leg side, but is unable to get it away
lovely ball pitched outside and drifting in as this one hits AB's front pad
short of a length and going leg side as this one is called wide
pitches this outside off as AB uses his feet to get close to it, but the ball ends up going to the off side
fuller length ball on middle which is eased down to long-on
this one is defended on the front foot with ease
AB able to drive this fuller length ball down to long-on

slightly slower and back of a length as once again AB tries to clear midwicket, but rushes the shot as he inside edges onto himself, then scampers back to get to his crease. Umar Akmal able to recover and throw down the striker's end, but AB was comfortably in
gets this to drift from outside off as Faf tries to work this away leg side
Faf steps down again but cannot find a way to work the ball in the gap
fired in on a slightly fuller length as Faf steers this on the off side, with the pair running hard to complete two
Afridi drags this one a bit too far down the leg side. Umpire calls wide
Faf uses his feet expertly to hammer this straight down the ground for six
once again Faf hits the gap a couple of balls before as the Pakistani fielders seem a bit lazy out there. Once again complete an easy two, when there should have been only one
length ball again as Faf just clips this through the midwicket region. There is no one around to prevent the duo from running another two. This has been an expensive over for Pakistan
Tanvir starts off with a slow bouncer wide of off stump which AB pulls in the gap between long-on and square leg. Lovely shot that from the South African

Tanvir follows AB, who is backing away to clear midwicket once more, as AB goes for the shot, but without any control, as this flies high in the air in the direction of long-on, who is able to take the catch with ease. Yet another wicket thrown away. Very uncharacteristic from the South Africans
Tanvir able to find a dot ball as Faf tries to get this away on the leg side
banged in short this time as Faf pulls through midwicket to get to his fourth T20 fifty. Good performance from the South African captain
overpitched outside off as Miller leans in to a drive through the covers
pitched short once more as Faf steps down to pull through the midwicket region for a single
going round the wicket to Faf who employs the sweep shot to get off strike
back of a length on leg as Miller is able to work this away off the back foot to the leg side
low full toss on leg as Faf steps away to drive this sweetly through extra-cover
slips in the doosra as Faf tucks this away without issue
back of a length and turning away outside off for Miller as he cross-bats this towards mid-on, with the pair running hard to complete two

beautiful change-up from Ajmal, who fires this one in on middle and leg. Strikes Miller flush on the lower pad as Ajmal pleads to the umpire for a wicket. Umpire hesitates, but then raises the finger. Another crucial wicket out of the way, but one suspects South Africa have done enough, going by the history of the series
lovely slower ball which goes across the batsman as he is surprised by it and the bounce on offer
tries it once more, expect fuller, as du Plessis paddles this behind square for a couple
drops this one shorter, and with a bit more pace from the leftie, as Faf misses this one entirely
great ball from Tanvir as he pitches this on a yorker length right on middle and leg. Faf was surprised by this one, but is able to run the bye
full again from Tanvir, this time a slower one, as Davids was already through his shot, but the ball just continues along on its trajectory

and Tanvir finishes things off with a wicket as he bowls a slow bouncer once more, this one not too high as Davids looks to cut it away over the infield, but instead drags it on to his stumps to end the innings
